com.feedhenry.sdk.sync

Class FHSyncClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.feedhenry.sdk.sync.FHSyncClient

  • public class FHSyncClient
extends Object
    The sync client is part of the FeedHenry data sync framework. It provides a mechanism to manage bi-direction data synchronization. For more details, please check data sync framework docs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String LOG_TAG

      Creates a new data record in dataset with pDataId.
      JSONObject delete(String pDataId, String pUID)
      Deletes a data record in the dataset with pDataId.
      void destroy()
      Stops all sync processes for all the datasets managed by the sync client.
      void forceSync(String pDataId)
      Causes the sync framework to schedule for immediate execution a sync.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static FHSyncClient getInstance()
        Gets the singleton instance of the sync client.
        Returns:
        the sync client instance

      • init

        public void init(android.content.Context pContext,
                 FHSyncConfig pConfig,
                 FHSyncListener pListener)
        Initializes the sync client. Should be called every time an app/activity starts.
        Parameters:
        pContext - The app context
        pConfig - The sync configuration
        pListener - The sync listener

      • setListener

        public void setListener(FHSyncListener pListener)
        Re-sets the sync listener.
        Parameters:
        pListener - the new sync listener

      • manage

        public void manage(String pDataId,
                   FHSyncConfig pConfig,
                   JSONObject pQueryParams)
        Uses the sync client to manage a dataset.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - The id of the dataset.
        pConfig - The sync configuration for the dataset. If not specified, the sync configuration passed in the initDev method will be used
        pQueryParams - Query parameters for the dataset
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - thrown if FHSyncClient isn't initialised.

      • manage

        public void manage(String pDataId,
                   FHSyncConfig pConfig,
                   JSONObject pQueryParams,
                   JSONObject pMetaData)
        Uses the sync client to manage a dataset.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - The id of the dataset.
        pConfig - The sync configuration for the dataset. If not specified, the sync configuration passed in the initDev method will be used
        pQueryParams - Query parameters for the dataset
        pMetaData - Meta for the dataset
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - thrown if FHSyncClient isn't initialised.

      • forceSync

        public void forceSync(String pDataId)
        Causes the sync framework to schedule for immediate execution a sync.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - The id of the dataset

      • list

        public JSONObject list(String pDataId)
        Lists all the data in the dataset with pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - The id of the dataset
        Returns:
        all data records. Each record contains a key "uid" with the id value and a key "data" with the JSON data.

      • read

        public JSONObject read(String pDataId,
                       String pUID)
        Reads a data record with pUID in dataset with pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset
        pUID - the id of the data record
        Returns:
        the data record. Each record contains a key "uid" with the id value and a key "data" with the JSON data.

      • create

        public JSONObject create(String pDataId,
                         JSONObject pData)
                  throws DataSetNotFound
        Creates a new data record in dataset with pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset
        pData - the actual data
        Returns:
        the created data record. Each record contains a key "uid" with the id value and a key "data" with the JSON data.
        Throws:
        DataSetNotFound - if the dataId is not known

      • update

        public JSONObject update(String pDataId,
                         String pUID,
                         JSONObject pData)
                  throws DataSetNotFound
        Updates an existing data record in dataset with pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset
        pUID - the id of the data record
        pData - the new content of the data record
        Returns:
        the updated data record. Each record contains a key "uid" with the id value and a key "data" with the JSON data.
        Throws:
        DataSetNotFound - if the dataId is not known

      • delete

        public JSONObject delete(String pDataId,
                         String pUID)
                  throws DataSetNotFound
        Deletes a data record in the dataset with pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset
        pUID - the id of the data record
        Returns:
        the deleted data record. Each record contains a key "uid" with the id value and a key "data" with the JSON data.
        Throws:
        DataSetNotFound - if the dataId is not known

      • listCollisions

        public void listCollisions(String pDataId,
                           FHActCallback pCallback)
                    throws FHNotReadyException
        Lists sync collisions in dataset with id pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset
        pCallback - the callback function
        Throws:
        FHNotReadyException - if FH is not initialized.

      • removeCollision

        public void removeCollision(String pDataId,
                            String pCollisionHash,
                            FHActCallback pCallback)
                     throws FHNotReadyException
        Removes a sync collision record in the dataset with id pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset
        pCollisionHash - the hash value of the collision record
        pCallback - the callback function
        Throws:
        FHNotReadyException - thrown if FH is not initialized.

      • resumeSync

        public void resumeSync(FHSyncListener listener)
        This method will begin synchronization. It should be called in the Activity.onResume() block.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to. If null the current listener will be used.

      • pauseSync

        public void pauseSync()
        This method will pause synchronization. It should be called in the Activity.onPause() block.

      • stop

        public void stop(String pDataId)
        Stops the sync process for dataset with id pDataId.
        Parameters:
        pDataId - the id of the dataset

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Stops all sync processes for all the datasets managed by the sync client.
